requirement.topic: XmlBlaster sends the subscription id in the qos arguments of an update
requirement.description: Sometimes when a client receives an update message, she wants to know which of its subscriptions caused this update. You may retrieve the subscription id in the qos argument of the update using the <subscriptionId> tag. This is is the same which she got as return value of the former subscribe() invocation.
requirement.example: <qos> <subscriptionId> <!-- The same id which you got returned from your previous subscribe() --> Subscription-00 0F 42 37 1A 20 1B 47 28 49 -192.168.10.212-null-952096108799-1 </subscriptionId> </qos>
requirement.author: xmlBlaster@marcelruff.info
